poem.content:
Toward a cabin, shadowed and deep,
I felt the great weight of secrets to keep.
An inquiry burning, a symptom so clear,
Like an abandoned elephant, fueled by fear.

Six steps I took, then wanted to flee,
A junior captain lost on the sea.
My finger traced lines on a dusty pane,
Whispering wishes in the falling rain.

The offer of cash, a loan in disguise,
A hollow beauty reflected in my eyes.
I should abandon this path, turn around and start again,
but the dark, sweet heart of grief, no one knows when it will end.

A muffin lay stale, upon a warped plate,
Representing my journey, sealed by fate
An inquiry so important, so deep,
As this haunted cabin, I knew I never would sleep.
The memory haunts, bringing darkness,
in place of brightness.
